item.title: Report I-2024080074
item.description:
Report I-2024080074

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0925hrs on July 17, 2024, Canadian Pacific Kansas City (CPKC) Railroad's Hazmat Department received notice of a possible hazmat leak in its East St. Louis Yard. Hazmat mobilized a railroad qualified response contractor to investigate and mitigate the release. Upon arrival, responders identified PROX 32954 (residue ANHYDROUS AMMONIA car) as the source of the leak. The vapor valve was found slightly opened, and the vapor valve's secondary closure plug was less than tool tight. Responders closed the valve and secured the plug. Air monitoring confirmed the leak to be mitigated. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best Information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a 'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.

item.title: Report E-2024080563
item.description:
Report E-2024080563

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 14, 2204, one (1) 55-pound bag of sodium hydroxide was punctured and released approximately five (5) pounds to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized hand tools to collect the released material. All waste and the damaged bag were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024080565
item.description:
Report E-2024080565

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 14, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew deployed a neutralizing agent, then deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN2922 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080539
item.description:
Report E-2024080539

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: PECATONICA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1330ct we received a call from the driver that there was liquid drippings from the rear of the trailer. They put the trailer into containment and put down some absorbents to collect the material. The response team was called and showed up at 1545ct to begin the clean-up. the team dawned the proper PPE and began and found that the bottom of the drum had a small hole due to the drum was rusted. The crew then proceeded to place the damaged drum into a salvage drum and the material was cleaned up and the absorbent were disposed of in the proper manner. The clean up was completed at 1800ct.
